course.title: Poems, Poets, Poetry
course.meeting_text: M., W., (F.), at 1, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: A study of poetry as the history and science of feeling: readings in major lyric poems of England and America. Emphasis on problems of invention and execution, and on the poet's choice of genre, stance, context, and structure. Other topics to be raised include the process of composition, the situating of a poem in its historical and poetic contexts, the notion of a poet's development, the lyric as dramatic speech, and the experimental lyric of the 20th century.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
